MS MCQs

    Manage Windows updates in the cloud

    »

    1. Laptops are used across your organization. Which mobile device management tool will you use to control device behavior and Windows updates distribution?

      You’ll use the Group Policy Management Console.

      You’ll use the Group Policy Editor.

      You’ll use Microsoft Intune.


    2. You want to validate upcoming feature updates and quality updates by enrolling some devices for Release Preview. What will you need to do?

      You’ll join the Windows Insider Program for Business and/or sync the Windows Insider Pre-release category.

      You’ll join the Windows Update Control Program for Business.

      You’ll join the Windows Insider Program and enable the “Do not connect to any Windows Update Internet locations” Group Policy.


    3. After configuring your devices, you want to monitor updates in your organization to identify any devices that have encountered an update failure. How will you do this?

      You’ll use the Windows Settings page’s built-in capabilities.

      You’ll use Microsoft Intune’s built-in update monitoring capabilities.

      You’ll use the Group Policy Editor.


    4. You’ve found out that Remove access to use all Windows Update features Group Policy has been enabled for some devices. How will the devices be affected?

      The users won’t be able to find out what Windows version they’re running, and they won’t be able to configure their own active hours.

      Updates won’t automatically be downloaded for those devices, and they can’t configure their own active hours.

      The users won’t be able to take action to download or install an update that is offered to the device. Nor will they be able to configure their own active hours.


    5. When a user clicks “Check for Updates” what updates are offered to them?

      Only updates that were approved by the admin (directly or via policy) are offered to the user.

      The latest updates available are offered to the user.

      No updates are offered to the user.
